seg-source.mrk: schemas

target.mrk: schemas

seg-source.mrk: creating

target.mrk: creating

trans-unit.source: A schema is a way to logically group objects in a single collection and provide a unique namespace for objects.

seg-source.mrk: A schema is a way to logically group objects in a single collection and provide a unique namespace for objects.

target.mrk: A schema is a way to logically group objects in a single collection and provide a unique namespace for objects.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

seg-source.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA { [ schemaName AUTHORIZATION userName ] | [ schemaName ] | [ AUTHORIZATION userName ] }

target.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA { [ schemaName AUTHORIZATION userName ] | [ schemaName ] | [ AUTHORIZATION userName ] }

trans-unit.source: The CREATE SCHEMA statement is used to create a schema. schema name cannot exceed 128 characters. Schema names must be unique within the database.

seg-source.mrk: The CREATE SCHEMA statement is used to create a schema.
schema name cannot exceed 128 characters.
Schema names must be unique within the database.

target.mrk: The CREATE SCHEMA statement is used to create a schema.
schema name cannot exceed 128 characters.
Schema names must be unique within the database.

trans-unit.source: A schema name cannot start with the prefix SYS (after case normalization). Use of the prefix SYS raises a SQLException.

seg-source.mrk: A schema name cannot start with the prefix SYS (after case normalization).
Use of the prefix SYS raises a SQLException.

target.mrk: A schema name cannot start with the prefix SYS (after case normalization).
Use of the prefix SYS raises a SQLException.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE SCHEMA statement is subject to access control when the derby.database.sqlAuthorization property is set to true for the database or system. Only the database owner can create a schema with a name different from the current user name, and only the the database owner can specify

seg-source.mrk: The CREATE SCHEMA statement is subject to access control when the derby.database.sqlAuthorization property is set to true for the database or system.
Only the database owner can create a schema with a name different from the current user name, and only the the database owner can specify

target.mrk: The CREATE SCHEMA statement is subject to access control when the derby.database.sqlAuthorization property is set to true for the database or system.
Only the database owner can create a schema with a name different from the current user name, and only the the database owner can specify

seg-source.mrk: AUTHORIZATION userName

target.mrk: AUTHORIZATION userName

trans-unit.source: with a user name other than the current user name.

seg-source.mrk: with a user name other than the current user name.

target.mrk: with a user name other than the current user name.

trans-unit.source: Although the SQL standard allows you to specify any authorizationIdentifier as an AUTHORIZATION argument, allows you to specify only a user, not a role.

seg-source.mrk: Although the SQL standard allows you to specify any authorizationIdentifier as an AUTHORIZATION argument, allows you to specify only a user, not a role.

target.mrk: Although the SQL standard allows you to specify any authorizationIdentifier as an AUTHORIZATION argument, allows you to specify only a user, not a role.

seg-source.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA examples

target.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA examples

trans-unit.source: To create a schema for airline-related tables and give the authorization ID <codeph>anita</codeph> access to all of the objects that use the schema, use the following syntax:

seg-source.mrk: To create a schema for airline-related tables and give the authorization ID <codeph>anita</codeph> access to all of the objects that use the schema, use the following syntax:

target.mrk: To create a schema for airline-related tables and give the authorization ID <codeph>anita</codeph> access to all of the objects that use the schema, use the following syntax:

seg-source.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA FLIGHTS AUTHORIZATION anita

target.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA FLIGHTS AUTHORIZATION anita

seg-source.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA EMP

target.mrk: CREATE SCHEMA EMP

trans-unit.source: To create a schema that uses the same name as the authorization ID <codeph>takumi</codeph>, use the following syntax:

seg-source.mrk: To create a schema that uses the same name as the authorization ID <codeph>takumi</codeph>, use the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: To create a table called <codeph>availability</codeph> in the <codeph>EMP</codeph> and <codeph>FLIGHTS</codeph> schemas, use the following syntax:

seg-source.mrk: To create a table called <codeph>availability</codeph> in the <codeph>EMP</codeph> and <codeph>FLIGHTS</codeph> schemas, use the following syntax:

target.mrk: To create a table called <codeph>availability</codeph> in the <codeph>EMP</codeph> and <codeph>FLIGHTS</codeph> schemas, use the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE FLIGHTS.AVAILABILITY (FLIGHT_ID CHAR(6) NOT NULL, SEGMENT_NUMBER INT NOT NULL, FLIGHT_DATE DATE NOT NULL, ECONOMY_SEATS_TAKEN INT, BUSINESS_SEATS_TAKEN INT, FIRSTCLASS_SEATS_TAKEN INT, CONSTRAINT FLT_AVAIL_PK PRIMARY KEY (FLIGHT_ID, SEGMENT_NUMBER, FLIGHT_DATE))

seg-source.mrk: CREATE TABLE FLIGHTS.AVAILABILITY (FLIGHT_ID CHAR(6) NOT NULL, SEGMENT_NUMBER INT NOT NULL, FLIGHT_DATE DATE NOT NULL, ECONOMY_SEATS_TAKEN INT, BUSINESS_SEATS_TAKEN INT, FIRSTCLASS_SEATS_TAKEN INT, CONSTRAINT FLT_AVAIL_PK PRIMARY KEY (FLIGHT_ID, SEGMENT_NUMBER, FLIGHT_DATE))

target.mrk: CREATE TABLE FLIGHTS.AVAILABILITY (FLIGHT_ID CHAR(6) NOT NULL, SEGMENT_NUMBER INT NOT NULL, FLIGHT_DATE DATE NOT NULL, ECONOMY_SEATS_TAKEN INT, BUSINESS_SEATS_TAKEN INT, FIRSTCLASS_SEATS_TAKEN INT, CONSTRAINT FLT_AVAIL_PK PRIMARY KEY (FLIGHT_ID, SEGMENT_NUMBER, FLIGHT_DATE))

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE EMP.AVAILABILITY (HOTEL_ID INT NOT NULL, BOOKING_DATE DATE NOT NULL, ROOMS_TAKEN INT, CONSTRAINT HOTELAVAIL_PK PRIMARY KEY (HOTEL_ID, BOOKING_DATE))

seg-source.mrk: CREATE TABLE EMP.AVAILABILITY (HOTEL_ID INT NOT NULL, BOOKING_DATE DATE NOT NULL, ROOMS_TAKEN INT, CONSTRAINT HOTELAVAIL_PK PRIMARY KEY (HOTEL_ID, BOOKING_DATE))

target.mrk: CREATE TABLE EMP.AVAILABILITY (HOTEL_ID INT NOT NULL, BOOKING_DATE DATE NOT NULL, ROOMS_TAKEN INT, CONSTRAINT HOTELAVAIL_PK PRIMARY KEY (HOTEL_ID, BOOKING_DATE))
